issue.title: Add applications to global menu
issue.body:
### Description

This pull request adds the Wazuh applications to the global menu.

Changes:
- Changed the redirections to adapt to the new global menu https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5827
- Move the Miscellaneous tab to the Wazuh plugin settings application: https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5830
- Adapt breadcrumb to the new applications https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5817
- Remove the `extensions.*` and `disabled_roles` settings from UI, wazuh.yml. `wazuh-registry.json` https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5988
- Remove the visibility of modules https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/issues/5965
  - Remove the view to configure the modules in the UI
  - Remove settings related to configuring the visibility of modules on the configuration file, ability to configure from UI
  - Remove the persistence of visibility of modules on `wazuh-registry.json` file
  - Add a migration to remove the  `extensions` key in the host data stored in `wazuh-registry.json`
- Remove the setting `disabled_roles` from the configuration file and UI.
  - Remove frontend request to check if the `wazuh` application should be visible
  - Remove endpoint to check if the `wazuh` application should be visible
- Remove the logic related to extensions
- Remove managementReducers key from Redux store and related action
  creators and related usage
- Remove toolsReducers key from Redux store and related action
  creators and related usage
- Remove securityReducers key from Redux store and related action
  creators and related usage
- Fix some breadcrumbs
- Modify the Overview application to display the new applications https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5852
- Remove `customization.logo.sidebar` setting https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5882
- Modify description of `customization.logo.app` setting
- Update sidebar menu and overview app https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5928
- Remove categories from overview https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5991
- Rename applications on agent menu https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5997
  - Refactor agent menu to use the applications and categories
  - Simplify the data saved in the local storage to keep the pinned applications
  - Remove the usage of extensions configuration
  - Change the data schema of the pinned applications
  - Rename the session storage key to wz-menu-agent-apps-pinned where the pinned applications are stored
  - Fix a problem with the agent menu header when the side menu is docked
- Add order to applications https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/6015
- Adapt the navigation between applications https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5926 https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5972 https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5983 https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5986
- Remove loading when switching the application https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5986
- Fix the breadcrumb of applications https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/5968
- Add an agent selector to IT Hygiene application https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-dashboard-plugins/pull/6005
  - Enhance the responsive of the agent welcome view

Side changes
- Create a service to define the redirections
- Remove some unwanted navigation by tabs
 
### Issues Resolved
#5841 

### Evidence

### Test
[Provide instructions to test this PR]

### Check List
- [ ] All tests pass
  - [ ] `yarn test:jest`
- [ ] New functionality includes testing.
- [ ] New functionality has been documented.
- [ ] Update [CHANGELOG.md](./../CHANGELOG.md)
- [ ] Commits are signed per the DCO using --signoff

commits.message:
feat(ism-rollover): add ism-rollover job

- Create new job on backend side
- Add new settings:
  - ism.rollover.enabled
  - ism.rollover.index_patterns
  - ism.rollover.min_doc_count
  - ism.rollover.min_idnex_age
  - ism.rollover.min_primary_shard_size
  - ism.rollover.overwrite
  - ism.rollover.priority
- Define the tasks of the job:
  - Create template for roll over alias indices related to alerts and
    archives
  - Create roll over ISM policy
  - Create date math index to start the roll over
- Add unit test
- Add README.md with documentation about the job

Fix Switchtab exception in dashboards (#6019)

* Define the component properties in the controller constructor

* Delete redundant fetch in Events refresh button

* Prevent duplicate request on Events initial requests

* Revert "Prevent duplicate request on Events initial requests"

This reverts commit db721a162e08c1636ca79c3f08528ba6f88dd01c.

* Remove dulplicate request on changeTabView

pull_request.title: Fix Switchtab exception in dashboards
pull_request.body:
### Description
Fix Switchtab exception in dashboards and some minor performance fixes to de Events and Kibana Discover module.

### Issues Resolved
#5900 

### Test
1. Navigate to threat hunting, refresh the page several times and check each time there are no "switchtab" exceptions in the console.
2. Make use of filters in any dashboard and check they work properly.
3. Go to Events tab and check there are no duplicated requests and filters work properly.

### Check List

- [ ] New functionality includes testing.

pull_request.title: Refactoring of the security configuration assessment
pull_request.body: ### Description Refactoring of the security configuration assessment. ### Issues Resolved #6059 ### Evidence ### Test ## Test ### Accessing SCA from the agent welcome redirection: #### Sca dashboard tab: - Go to the agent welcome, select an agent, in the SCA: Lastest scans table select a policy, verify that you have been successfully redirected to the sca module to the dashboard tab and that in this tab you see the information about the selected policy. - In the sca policy table try selecting any policy and verify that the other two graphs are updated with the information of the selected policy. - Try changing the agent and verify that the graphs are updated based on the same agent. #### Sca inventory tab: - Verify that the table with all the policies of the selected agent is shown. - Try to change agent, verify that the table is updated with the selected agent policies. ### Accessing SCA from the module: #### Sca dashboard tab: - Verify that by default information about the first policy in the policy table is shown in the graphs. - Verify that when selecting any policy from the policy table the other two graphs are updated with the information of the selected policy. - Try changing the agent and verify that the graphs are updated based on the same agent. #### Sca inventory tab: - Verify that the table with all the policies of the selected agent is shown. - Try to change agent, verify that the table is updated. - Go to the security events section and verify that it works correctly since it shares components with the sca module. ### Check List - [x] All tests pass - [x] `yarn test:jest` - [x] New functionality includes testing. - [x] New functionality has been documented. - [x] Update [CHANGELOG.md](./../CHANGELOG.md) - [x] Commits are signed per the DCO using --signoff

issue.title: [ISM rollover] Upload rollover policy during app's startup
issue.body:
## Description

We are working on a default, out-of-the-box ISM policy to automatically manage indices over time, triggering administrative actions over the indices based on index's age and size.

For the time being, the Wazuh app has been selected as the component in charge of injecting this policy to the indexer during its startup, probably as part of the health check process.

The policy can be seen [here](https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh/issues/18999#issuecomment-1773038410).

## Related issues

- https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh/issues/18999

## Requirements 

### Non-functional

- Easy to configure (shard size, index age and minimum documents).
- Not modifiable by cloud users.
- The policy won't overwrite an existing ISM policy. Feedback about this situation must be provided, either via logging, in-app notifications or both.

### Functional

- The ISM policy will be added automatically, without any user's action.
- The ISM policy will be uploaded only if there is no other policy already managing the `wazuh-alerts` / `wazuh-archives` indices.
- The ISM will be updated if the policy ID matches (`wazuh_rollover_policy`) and the `overwrite` flag is enabled.

### Implementation restrictions

- The indexer has to be up and running (green state).
- The policy can be customized using the `wazuh.yml` file.

## Plan

- [x] Include and read policy settings from the `wazuh.yml` file.
- [x] Upload alias index templates for `wazuh-alerts` and `wazuh-archives` indices
- [x] Upload the policy using the indexer's API, during the app's startup.
- [x] Kickoff the rollover alias
- [ ] Update internal documentation

To start the rollover:
```
curl -k -u admin:admin_password -X PUT "https://wazuh_indexer_ip_or_dns:9200/%3Cwazuh-alerts-4.x-%7Bnow%2Fd%7D-000001%3E?pretty" -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d'
{
  "aliases": {
    "wazuh-alerts": {
      "is_write_index": true
    }
  }
}
'
```

comment.body: I am adding unit tests to the process.

Merge 4.5.2 into 4.5.3 (#5856)

* Bump revision to 02 (4.5.2) (#5844)

bump: revision to 02

* Add environments for 4.5 (#5797)

* Add environments for 4.5

* Add saml required: false

* Fix readme

* Fix readme 4.4

* Update README.md

* Update README.md

---------

Co-authored-by: Ian Yenien Serrano <63758389+yenienserrano@users.noreply.github.com>
Fix package URLs in aarch64 commands
Update CHANGELOG

[Register Agent ] Fixed package URLs in aarch64 commands (#5879) ### Description Fix package URLs in aarch64 commands Closes #5870 ### Test Check all the LINUX commands 1. Select one-by-one Linux Distros 2. Check if the package URL works (copy and paste in a new browser tab) - **Important:** Use `package-dev` and `/pre-release/` instead /4.x/ 3. Check in the command if the package name and package downloaded have the same name 4. If you have the same distro, check the agent package installation ## Linux RPM amd64 ```bash curl -o wazuh-agent-4.6.0-1.x86_64.rpm https://packages.wazuh.com/4.x/yum/wazuh-agent-4.6.0-1.x86_64.rpm && sudo WAZUH_MANAGER='0.0.0.0' rpm -ihv wazuh-agent-4.6.0-1.x86_64.rpm ``` > Annotation: > In this case, the `amd64.rpm` package doesn't exist because of that we use the `x86_64.rpm` ## Linux DEB amd64 ```bash wget https://packages.wazuh.com/4.x/apt/pool/main/w/wazuh-agent/wazuh-agent_4.6.0-1_amd64.deb && sudo WAZUH_MANAGER='0.0.0.0' dpkg -i ./wazuh-agent_4.6.0-1_amd64.deb ``` ## Linux RPM aarch64 ```bash curl -o wazuh-agent-4.6.0-1.aarch64.rpm https://packages.wazuh.com/4.x/yum/wazuh-agent-4.6.0-1.aarch64.rpm && sudo WAZUH_MANAGER='0.0.0.0' rpm -ihv wazuh-agent-4.6.0-1.aarch64.rpm ``` ## Linux DEB aarch64 ```bash wget https://packages.wazuh.com/4.x/apt/pool/main/w/wazuh-agent/wazuh-agent_4.6.0-1_arm64.deb && sudo WAZUH_MANAGER='0.0.0.0' dpkg -i ./wazuh-agent_4.6.0-1_arm64.deb ``` > Annotation: > In this case, the `aarch64.deb` package doesn't exist because of that we use the `arm64.deb` ### Check List - [ ] All tests pass - [ ] `yarn test:jest` - [ ] New functionality includes testing. - [ ] New functionality has been documented. - [ ] Update [CHANGELOG.md](./../CHANGELOG.md) - [ ] Commits are signed per the DCO using --signoff

Fixed install macOS agent commands (#5888) ### Description Fix the macOS installation command Closes #5886 ## Evidence ## Intel (intel64) ![Captura de pantalla 2023-09-12 a la(s) 13 57 12](https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-kibana-app/assets/6089438/fbdef941-d0c8-4d61-a1ec-922877132329) ![Captura de pantalla 2023-09-12 a la(s) 13 57 21](https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-kibana-app/assets/6089438/d4c695d0-8ea2-4fc6-b6b2-7e0759aba6fa) ```bash curl -so wazuh-agent.pkg https://packages.wazuh.com/4.x/macos/wazuh-agent-4.6.0-1.intel64.pkg && echo "WAZUH_MANAGER='0.0.0.0' && WAZUH_AGENT_NAME='agent-name'" > /tmp/wazuh_envs && sudo installer -pkg ./wazuh-agent.pkg -target / ``` ### Command output ### ossec.conf with parameters specified ## Apple silicon (arm64) ![Captura de pantalla 2023-09-12 a la(s) 13 57 52](https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-kibana-app/assets/6089438/767aedd3-9611-4462-b5e7-a25390f3f057) ![Captura de pantalla 2023-09-12 a la(s) 13 58 11](https://github.com/wazuh/wazuh-kibana-app/assets/6089438/3fe3d61d-6511-41a5-be80-dcdb24713bd3) ```bash curl -so wazuh-agent.pkg https://packages.wazuh.com/4.x/macos/wazuh-agent-4.6.0-1.arm64.pkg && echo "WAZUH_MANAGER='0.0.0.0' && WAZUH_AGENT_NAME='agent-name'" > /tmp/wazuh_envs && sudo installer -pkg ./wazuh-agent.pkg -target / ``` ### Command output ### ossec.conf with parameters specified ### Test 1. Go to Agents section 2. Click Deploy new agent button 3. Select macOS operting system and complete the form 4. Check the installation and start commands ### Check List - [x] All tests pass - [x] `yarn test:jest` - [x] New functionality includes testing. - [x] New functionality has been documented. - [x] Update [CHANGELOG.md](./../CHANGELOG.md) - [x] Commits are signed per the DCO using --signoff
